attributes.action:
COVID 19. 3x2.
SHOPS 2 SAME ITEMS.  QUEUES 2 METRES  .
OUTSIDE  2 TOGETHER
attributes.additional_details:
1.To help stop panic buying.
2. To help keep social distance.
3. To minimise risk of spreading virus
attributes.background:
1.Commence an immediate START on the stopping the purchase of the same article.
2.Queues standing 2 metres apart. 
3.Outside public walking only 2 together

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that it is stopping all gatherings of more than two people in public: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/full-guidance-on-staying-at-home-and-away-from-others/full-guidance-on-staying-at-home-and-away-from-others

The Government has also published guidance on maintaining social distancing in supermarkets: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-guidance-for-food-businesses/guidance-for-food-businesses-on-coronavirus-covid-19#maintaining-social-distancing-in-specific-food-business-settings

Implementing this guidance is a matter for individual supermarkets.

While a number of supermarkets have imposed limits on the number of items that shoppers can purchase, the Government has not required retailers to do so. We have published a petition calling on the Government to introduce limits on per customer purchases in all supermarkets, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300766

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here:
https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
 
Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
